title: Graziela Padoin receives Certified Destination Marketing Executive Designation
text:
Graziela Padoin receives Certified Destination Marketing Executive Designation Graziela Padoin receives Certified Destination Marketing Executive Designation Details Category: Agency & Association   12:00 Graziela Padoin, GainingEdge’s Business Development Consultant in Latin America, has earned the Certified Destination Management Executive (CDME) designation by DMAI – Destination Marketing Association International. The focus of this programme is on Vision, Leadership, Productivity and the implementation of business strategies for CVBs and DMOs. 
Based in Buenos Aires, Argentina, Graziela is currently working on several projects for the development and improvement of destinations in this region. Her specialties are marketing, strategic planning, business development, international relations, business events and industry training. She is also working with the Greater Houston CVB for their tourism and business meetings in South America. She recently completed a GainingEdge project with the Latin American CVBs Association, supporting six destinations in four countries to improve their strategies and strengthen their competitiveness; while also involved on a global study for the UNTWO on the decision making process of association events. Graziela has over 14 years of experience in the industry including marketing and strategic development projects for hotels and resorts with convention center facilities. She managed the events department in Porto Alegre Convention & Visitors Bureau before joining GainingEdge. “I’m very proud to be the first professional in the region to be awarded with the most important international certification as a specialist in destination marketing and management. At GainingEdge, we help destinations to generate more business and attract visitors, in addition to providing individuals with skills and abilities development, so it’s always important to share best practices and get involved in high level discussions. Taking this distinguished credential was one more effort to contribute to the highest standards and competency to the industry, as a response to a changing world.” says Graziela after getting her CDME award. “The CDME program helps build capacity for destination marketing organizations in the world to better prepare for the future” says Paul Vallee, Executive Consultant – Americas for GainingEdge. “As the recently released Phase Two of DestinationNEXT advises - a project that GainingEdge helped engineer on behalf of DMAI - the destination marketing industry is undergoing significant transformation which will require innovate and progressive professionals such as Graziela to ensure success.” Related articles
